noun.description: A thing on which a bird alights or roosts, typically a branch or a horizontal rod or bar in a birdcage.

verb.description: (of a bird) alight or rest on something.
examples: a herring gull perched on the mast

phrases: will this knock London off its perch as Europe's leading financial center?
Can anyone really see a midfield knocking them off their perch?
There is no point in being over ambitious and aiming for to knock Kerry off their perch.
They are still the deepest team in the East, and knocking them off their perch won't be easy.
The high-flying Tykes had run up a record seven successive victories in the tournament before Durham knocked them off their perch last year.
origin: Middle English (in the general sense pole, stick): from Old French perche, from Latin pertica measuring rod, pole.
